title: “It’s Great Bathroom Reading” – Sonam Kapoor On The Spat Between Karan Johar & Kangana Ranaut
text:
Sukriti Gumber Mar . 16 . 2017 Sonam Kapoor (source: Instagram | @sonamkapoor) 
Sonam Kapoor was recently asked about the public spat between Karan Johar and Kangana Ranaut but she averted the topic by saying she has done only one film with the former, and cannot comment on him practicing nepotism. 
In an interview with NDTV, when she was again asked to comment on the entire episode, she called the feud distasteful, and said it was a “great bathroom read”: 
I said it was very entertaining. Every morning I wake up and it’s great bathroom reading. It’s mudslinging of the worst kind. I don’t know Kangana. I know Karan very well. I find Kangana very entertaining and that’s about it. I don’t want to comment on something that looks opportunistic, honestly. And I believe you are a feminist when you build other people up, especially other women. All I can say is that I respect the choices that she has made in her career till now. I made a decision when I was very young after my second or first Koffee With Karan – it was that I would not do mudslinging when other actors and actresses are concerned because I would not do it for TRP’s, I would not do it for a channel and I felt if I have to give an opinion or be opinionated, it would have to be for something that is relevant and I don’t think dragging someone down or criticizing someone or having this public spat – I find it very distasteful. You can set examples without washing your dirty linen in public. 
She further added that both Kangana and Karan are right in their own positions, and defended Karan saying he has launched 12 directors, which does not make him nepotistic: 
Karan has only taken me in one movie – I Hate Luv Storys, 9 years back and if he really was someone who was a flagbearer of nepotism, I’m sure he wouldn’t have launched 12 directors. So, both of them are right in their own way. I just find this argument, something that I feel like, I don’t want to be a part of and I don’t want to comment on. I don’t see anything that is worth commenting on. 
Thoughts?
